channel.title: free on Blog
channel.description: Recent content in free on Blog

item.title: Fun System Tool for Process Analysis and Debugging
item.description: Over time I used quite an arsenal of various small utilities and tools for Windows that do some specific task. Some of them are outdated, no longer maintained, others I simply forgot because they were rarely used. One tool that I’ve been using for a while now is Process Explorerby Mark Russinovich who created many great tools to the Windows platform. If you don’t know this tool it’s a replacement for the Task Manager with many great features for monitoring processes, file handles, etc.

item.title: Free stuff and some R&R music
item.description: As always there are too many ideas in my head, stuff I want to learn, books and blogs I want to read, things I want to share with others. When there’s too much going on it becomes more difficult to write about any of those, but I’m trying to become more organized so I’ll do my best to post regularly and more often, whenever I have something to say. I’ve found some really cool free online magazines about BSD operating systems and hacking:
